intro: Aspidogyne colombiana, commonly known as the Colombian aspidogyne, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes approximately 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers with four petals. It produces small, fleshy fruits that contain a single seed. Aspidogyne colombiana is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
